Posts.Content: Hi Nonrag The wigbank takes them.  They are through out the uk and take wigs ladies are finnished with professionally clean them and sell them for about £20 or so to ladies that need them .  It's a charity it's at www.wigbank.com to find your nearest.  I found it in the back of coping with hair loss Macmillan booklet.   Yours Shirl
Posts.Title: Charity?

Posts.Content: Hi Crystalkitty Mavelous news!!!!  Another milestone passed !!!  Have a great celebration  xxxx
Posts.Title: Last radiotherapy session done and ticked off - yay!

Posts.Content: Hi jjtoo I had a mammogram and 3 weeks later notice I had a dent and lump in my breast.  Mammogram was clear and didn't show anything up.  It may have been there previous but ihadn't noticed it.  The gp referred me and was seen in local hospital clinic and told it may be bruising from mammogram but biopsies taken.  It was cancerous.  I had full treatment, chemo 6 cycles, mastectomy and auxiliary node clearence and radio therapy.  It shows mammograms have limitations and I am very greatful my gp and medical team were on it so quickly. Now a year on back to work ect...   I live alone too.   Chemo was at local hosp Borders General.  I drove to some and my daughter took me to some.  Surgery was in Edinburgh and radio therapy.  They have a dedicated car park for cancer patient, you take your appointment card or letter and car park attendant checks it and gets you a space.  Breast nurse or gp can arrange transport or dependant on need, Edinburgh has a stay in area during week while getting radio therapy.  Red cross also has volunteer drivers.  At the mo wait and get info and try not to over think.  Contact your breast nurse, they are great at answering questions or Macmillan help line for info.  Wish you all the best Shirl
Posts.Title: Anyone else had cyst become cancerous?

Posts.Content: Hi Jan  Glad it was of some help.  I'm in gala but over your way now and again.  A nice part of the country.  Apparently you can friend folk on this to private message, if you want to chat.  I check site out now and again : )  take care.  All the best. Shirl
Posts.Title: Anyone else had cyst become cancerous?

Posts.Content: Hi Julie Thank you for posting such an uplifting post.  Well done to you daughter and the kids for doing the run.xxx
Posts.Title: I am a survivor!!

Posts.Content: Hi Jan I had Invasive ductal BC, stage 2 (below 5 cm) which had spread to lymph nodes (early breast ca) grade 3 (quick growing) ER positive (responsive to hormone therapy).   The RT was to mop up any other lymph nodes which were apparently not showing signs of disease but just to make sure, they were zapped.  Belt and braces!!  I chose to go to Edinburgh for surgery.  The BGH is good at surgery too, but I made a choice.  As I explained there are options for travel, maybe gp can arrange transport, or red cross car, or a friend will be willing to drive or when having RT you can stay in as it's mon to fri and only take 10 to 15 mins each time.  Most of it getting into position. Discuss treatment options with your onocologist and surgeon.  The breast  nurse can be contacted at Macmillan centre in BGH by phone or a meeting.  Be guided by there advice.  Hope this helps.  Where are you traveling from? Shirl
Posts.Title: Anyone else had cyst become cancerous?

Posts.Content: Hi Jan  Glad it was of some help.  I'm in gala but over your way now and again.  A nice part of the country.  Apparently you can friend folk on this to private message, if you want to chat.  I check site out now and again : )  take care.  All the best. Shirl

Discuss treatment options with your onocologist and surgeon.  The breast  nurse can be contacted at Macmillan centre in BGH by phone or a meeting.  Be guided by there advice.  Hope this helps.  Where are you traveling from? Posts.Content: Hi jjtoo I had a mammogram and 3 weeks later notice I had a dent and lump in my breast.  Mammogram was clear and didn't show anything up.  It may have been there previous but ihadn't noticed it.  The gp referred me and was seen in local hospital clinic and told it may be bruising from mammogram but biopsies taken.  It was cancerous.  I had full treatment, chemo 6 cycles, mastectomy and auxiliary node clearence and radio therapy.  It shows mammograms have limitations and I am very greatful my gp and medical team were on it so quickly. Now a year on back to work ect...   I live alone too.   Chemo was at local hosp Borders General.  I drove to some and my daughter took me to some.  Surgery was in Edinburgh and radio therapy.  They have a dedicated car park for cancer patient, you take your appointment card or letter and car park attendant checks it and gets you a space.  Breast nurse or gp can arrange transport or dependant on need, Edinburgh has a stay in area during week while getting radio therapy.  Red cross also has volunteer drivers.  At the mo wait and get info and try not to over think.  Contact your breast nurse, they are great at answering questions or Macmillan help line for info.  Wish you all the best Shirl
Posts.Title: Anyone else had cyst become cancerous?

Posts.Content: Hi Hawkster You have defo come to the right place for info and support.  I went to gp begin sept and saw breast clinic 10 days later.  I had a dent in right breast .  I expected it to be just a cyst or bruising.  I had exam , X-ray, ultrasound and biopsies.  I had a holiday with youngest daughter planned so asked for my results by phone, dispite the breast surgeons misgivings.  I drove 400 plus miles to Wales to see my daughteI.  Spent the week enjoying nice days out and lovely meals together.  I told no one ( I have 2 daughter 27 and 29). The nurse phoned on Friday.  It was a shock.  I went for a walk that evening with my daughter and her boyfriend and explained to them then.  I explained the result and that I would be returning home in a few days to the best team and treatment available .  I spent next few days reassuring her and drove home and explained again to her sister.   Now I am 2 months on from finishing radio therapy.  I had chemo first ,it finnished in January, surgery (mastectomy, auxila node clearance and reconstruction) in February . I will be back to work in 6 weeks and am planning to return south for another lovely holiday.   The crew on this site are great any questions or just to share with.  It's hard, we have all been where you are now and feel for you.  One bit at a time you kick its ass.  Once the plan is worked out it seems to go faster.  It's do able .   Thoughts with you and your family.   Xxx
Posts.Title: newly diagnosed and terrified.

Posts.Content: Happy birthday to you hoo Ali xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Happy birthday to you hoo Ali xxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY BIRTHDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy  Yeah I loss weight a few weeks after chemo.  During chemo I ate random stuff, I tried to eat health, but the nause and the altered taste dictated what I fancied.  I hoped I would loose it later when my appietietite was back to normal.  The steroids loaded on water as well.  Eventually it's settled down (6 months on) back to swimming and walking and weight back to what it was before it all.   Shirl xxx
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy  Yeah I loss weight a few weeks after chemo.  During chemo I ate random stuff, I tried to eat health, but the nause and the altered taste dictated what I fancied.  I hoped I would loose it later when my appietietite was back to normal.  The steroids loaded on water as well.  Eventually it's settled down (6 months on) back to swimming and walking and weight back to what it was before it all.   Shirl xxx
Posts.Title: Weight loss after chemo radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi MrsD Well done you , fantastic news another big step !!!   Xxx
Posts.Title: DONE IT !!!

Posts.Content: Hi Tilly Haven't heard of this treatment.  When I had rads I was given steroid cream for to be used sparingly at night and moisturiser for mornings given by radiotherapy team when I had assessment and marking .  to contine through out the 3 weeks of rads and for 3 weeks after.  check with your team you should have had a prescription.  I had very slight pinkness at end of the three weeks but it faded within a few days.  Hope all goes well. Shirl
Posts.Title: R1 and R2 treatments for skin damage caused by radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Kazash The waiting for results is the worst bit.   Once the plan is decided it's better.  Good luck today.  Xxx
Posts.Title: ha

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah I've just had chemo number 6 and hopefully last 6 days ago.  Mouth sore and dry everything tastes weird .  Sore shoulders and legs.  No energy, but this will start wearing off in next few days .  So looking forward to fried egg with a soft yolk , toast and chinese / Indian meals again in the next few weeks.  Tonight it was corn flake.   Home made stir fry with 7 thai spice and noodles is good in a couple of days from now  when mouth not so sore. : ).
Posts.Title: Rotting away

Posts.Content: Hi medusa I was wearing Asda's soft cotton sports bras which were great.  I had a right mastectomy , node clearence and reconstruction.  I have been told to never wear a wired bra as it can puncture reconstruction.  I have tried wireless bras with some soft padding with ok results , but I asked my breast nurse for advice as my reconstructed boob is a lot smaller than my remaining boob .  She gave me a silicon shell to cover my reconstructed boob and make it up to the same size and the right shape , as I am getting back to work and wanted to look right.  The silicon shell works fine in my own bras but sticks to the skin.  I got fantastic feminine patterned bras ( and I think you can get matching pants). From M & S online they fit as well and look as good as my wired bras used to be and they have cotton pockets for inserts/ prosesises .  I nearly cried I was so delighted with the lovely feminine fit . Got twin packs post surgery so comfy.  In the changing rooms one of the girls asked where I got my bras, she didn't know anything about my surgery ect...  !!!  So happy to find normal looking and lovely underwear.  I feel better in my clothes again.   Hope this helps.       Shirl
Posts.Title: Prosthetic boobs :)

Posts.Content: Hi folks Prior to BC I walked, cycled, swam 60 lengths 3 times a week, ate healthy and worked in a very active high stress job.  So now I still swim not as many lenths, walk , eat health and back to job again , but not stressing as much.  Every thing in balance, enjoy! Shirl x
Posts.Title: Lifestyle changes?

Posts.Content: Hi Fiona  Sorry about this.  I got it from my breast nurse.  When I asked if she knew where I could buy such a product locally.   She had various sizes in a cupboard for me to try.  The one I have is from Amoena.  It was on NHS.  So ask. Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Warrenb39 I had mastectomy of right breast and immediate reconstruction, then radio therapy.  The reconstruction is smaller than my other breast but the surgeon is going to use my own tummy fat to round my reconstructed breast.  My good breast is going to be lifted at the same time I get fat in other breast and once they heal they should be the same .  I am waiting a year to let reconstruction and scar fully settle first.  At the moment I have a shell of silicone I wear in my m & s post surgery bra that makes my mastectomy side up to same size and I look good in my clothes, tight fitting and other wise even if I say so my self.  Hope this helps. Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi I said sorry because you are hijacking someone else's post.  To answer,  I got silicon shell from breast nurse to wear in bra to even up look.  No secondary tumours.  Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi I said sorry because you are hijacking someone else's post.  To answer,  I got silicon shell from breast nurse to wear in bra to even up look.  No secondary tumours.  Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Maybe I picked this up wrong , sorry again. Good night.  Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Spenfold  Fantastic news it's great to feel released and moving on.  Great to hear you last rad is tomorrow too kateandbiz .  It's a bit emotional looking back on the journey, but you've done it. !!!!   I have the surgeon to see in July to check  mastectomy wound and reconstruction after the radio therapy (finnished end of April).  Not sure I won't need more surgery, but it will be cosmetic not getting rid of the criter.  The onocologist saw me last week , I won't see her again for a year!!!  So all good, I just need to get my energy back. : ).     Marvellous news ladies, big celebrations!!!!   Xxx
Posts.Title: Said my goodbyes

Posts.Content: Hi Maybe I picked this up wrong , sorry again. Good night.  Shirl
Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi Fiona  Sorry about this.  I got it from my breast nurse.  When I asked if she knew where I could buy such a product locally.   She had various sizes in a cupboard for me to try.  The one I have is from Amoena.  It was on NHS.  So ask. Shirl

Posts.Title: Reconstruction surgery

Posts.Content: Hi folks After mastectomy, chemo and radio therapy.  I was still fatigued and exhausted months later.   My daughter when we went for a 4 mile walk over hills, I felt was an amazing achievement.  "never mind next year we'll do the west highland way" !!!!!!!! "after all people publish that they cycle hundreds of miles and do marathons after cancer".   I felt useless and demoralised .
Posts.Title: Annoyed!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Heather So happy to hear your through with the treatment.  It's a rocky road, mine finnished end of April.  Just regular surgeon and oncology visits to go.  These lovely folk on this site are such a wonderful support in dark and no so dark times.  Have a wonderful Xmas and all the very best. Shirl
Posts.Title: Four weeks post radiation and my thoughts

Posts.Content: Hi butterfly That sounds great.  I'm looking forward to doing a bit more.  FEC T chemo finished on Jan 20th and mastectomy with reconstruction using chest muscle and node clearance was on 26Feb so healing well.  Building up the walking, managed 5 miles walking with my daughter and her dogs, they sniff everything so no fast going which is good at the moment.   I started radio therapy on Thursday 9 th April and will have to wait till its finnished plus a few weeks before I go back to swimming.  I miss it, I had a dream about it!!  I was swimming 2 or 3 times a week for an hour at a time.  Pilates or yoga sounds like a good idea though to get this arm stretched.   Moving on wards and upwards ladies. : ).    Xxx
Posts.Title: gym

Posts.Content: HiJoysilvercat I thought I was stuck with stay at home holidays for years after treatment, but these quotes sound no too bad.  Gives hope of a nice holiday at the end of all this : ) .
Posts.Title: Holiday insurance Nowicantravel.co.uk

Posts.Content: Hi mike many congrats.  Have a lovely holiday , you both deserve it after all the treatment. : ). Xxx
Posts.Title: It's our anniversary today

Posts.Content: Hi Veronica I was to!d PIP was if you were unable to carry out activities of daily living and needed significant assistance and mobility was impaired significantly too. I was told that having secondary incurable tumours and a a hip replacement due to a tumour, was not enough, as I had not been told I had less than 6 months to live.
Posts.Title: Does anyone know anything about PIP?

Posts.Content: hi little wombat I didn't tell anyone I was getting biopsies and tests for a breast legion. I had booked to go to my daughters in Wales anyway.  So told the breast nurse to phone me with the result.  I drove 450 miles to daughters and she was working part of the time. As was her boyfriend.  I was in a busy market when the phone call came through.  When someone asks if you are alone, which I was, I just said spit it out.  The news knocked the wind from me all the same.  Then I had to work out how to tell my 2 daughters.  Well had tea and then I got her boyfriend on his own and said she might need some support for a while and explained to him.  I went for a walk with her and told her then.  We hugged cried and I reassured her I had a great team behind me and they would do A B and C so she knew what the plan would be.  We talk on Skype once or twice on Skype every week though out the treatment and she was up. Couple of times.  Older daughter I swore younger to secracy before I drove home and told her.  She just said so what's the plan? And I explained.  She supported me by going to chemo with me ect..  I would have been livid if they did not tell me and they were ill, so I had to respect them an tell them.  You wouldn't want them to fudge you.  It's very treatable and many ladies have gone through this.  Macmillan can help them with info too.   Hope all goes well.  Xxx
Posts.Title: WOULD APPRECIATE ADVISE ON HOW TO TELL FAMILY

Posts.Content: Hi girls Yeah my nails seemed to be doing ok at the beginning of treatment but eventually went ridged and tops peeled of all except right big toe it's still got a funny blob ridge holding on after finishing chemo in January. The hair is salt and pepper grey and curly when it came back.  I am getting it cut for the first time and dyed on Friday .   The joys : ).  I like it curly though, it used to be poker straight!
Posts.Title: neddys/moaning cows club !!!!

Posts.Content: Fantastic news Shirl3 Give you a boost to keep going with it all.  Great Xmas prezzie. Shirl
Posts.Title: Mri results

Posts.Content: Hi Nina Sorry to hear you had a lump.  This is the hardest bit waiting on results.  I went to visit my daughter for a week, to take my attention of it a bit (I didn't tell her about it till the results were back) .   Try and find stuff to do and keep busy, it helps.  This site is great, we are all with you.  Post any time.   Most lumps come back benign the nurse said.    Wish you all the best. Shirl xxx
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy result

Posts.Content: Well done grannylara  and  littlesusie !!!  Wee victory dance round the settee !   Xxx
Posts.Title: I've only gone and done it !!

Posts.Content: Hi folks I had problems with indigestion and heart burn with and after chemo.  I bought ranitidine in the supermarket, I did check with medics first and it was ok to take with the chemo ect.. It's only about £1.50 a box and ate what I felt like on bad days (coco pops and complan soup sometime). As I generally had/have a very health diet.   Hope you feel better soon. Shirl
Posts.Title: sickness and indigestion

Posts.Content: Hi Cjo I had a red under new boob .  I had a mastectomy and implant.  I was told to wear the stretchy comfort bras just now.  I need to look for better looking bras for later, might take a look at cottonique, thanks.  It's hard to find nice ones that are non wire and comfy.    Hope it better and more comfortable soon. Shirl x
Posts.Title: Implant - red along bra line and rash

Posts.Content: Hi Ellen I had chemo, then 5 weeks later right mastectomy, auxillary node clearance and reconstruction with implant.  It is under my chest muscle, with mesh on the bottom .  It was uncomfortable to begin with post op but I was given pain relief and it worked well and needed to be taken regularly for a week or two.    It was done on the 26th of February.  I then had radio therapy.  My wound was tender for a couple of month but I kept doing my exercises given by the staff and I now go swimming, which stretching and strengthening it.  I am back to work .   It took about 3 months to start getting my energy back aft the radio therapy,  but kept the exercising and going for walks helped counter the fatigue. Hope all goes well for you and a full recovery soon. Shirl
Posts.Title: Diep reconstruction - recovery

Posts.Content: Good morning ladies, hope your treatment /recovery is going well.  It's pouring down in Galashiels in the Scottish borders.   Tv day me thinks after walking the dogs.  I'm still lacking bounce 3 weeks after rads so that's my excuse.   Have a good day all.  : ).    Xx
Posts.Title: Good morning.

Posts.Content: Fantastic news.  Congrats xxx
Posts.Title: Result of first mammogram today ...

Posts.Content: Hi Mandy I had swelling in my upper arm.  It's a year since I had a right mastectomy and auxila node clearance.  I had been lifting heavy shopping bags and heavy moving at work.  I have been more careful since and I contacted my breast nurse and got a leaflet explaining simple exercises to reduce the swelling.  I can be referred to the physio if I want, but the exercises and with being a bit more careful has worked andit hasn't come back.  Contact your breast nurse it doesn't have to be bad before your seen or get help.  Better getting it sooner rather than later. Shirl
Posts.Title: Swelling in arm

Posts.Content: Hi Sribblinglady You mentioned in another thread a few days ago you had swelling and a heamatoma, if now you also have some slight bleeding , it might be a good idea to have your breast nurse or gp to check your wound .   Its great the cancers all gone but the wound needs looked after to see it heals well and you can put this bit behind you. Hope all goes well.  Take care.  Xxx
Posts.Title: Bleeding from incision

Posts.Content: Hi Mightymo Great to be a Neddy!!!   It's a bit oh a thought going back to the grind.  I started phased return 2 weeks ago my brain seems to be  full of cotton wool.  Taking ages to get back into the swing and energy not back yet.  Take your time.  They can't discriminate against you because of the cancer, not easy though.  Thinking about you.  To win the lottery would be fab.  Hardest decision which cocktail.mmmmmm........ Shirl
Posts.Title: Yippee I did it.

Posts.Content: Hi Munchkin I found a dent in my breast and afterthinking about it I phoned gp and was told an appointment would be a week away.  I hung up then thought no not accepting that.  I phoned back and explained to receptionist I had a dent in breast and hard area under it .  She got me in for afternoon that same day.  Don't just accept the wait.  Phone back, if they refuse ask for a telephone appointment to speak to a gp and that should get the ball rolling.  Get on to it girl , be polite but firm.  Let us know how you get on this site is full of lovely people that can answer your questions and give support.  Thoughts are with you I was there 9 months aplanning treatment past and moving on.  Take care xxx
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do

Posts.Content: Hi munchkin Thats good .  Thinking about you .  Hope this gets things moving for you.  The quicker you get on to it the faster you'll get answers.  Could be many things change our breasts not necessarily breast cancer. X
Posts.Title: Don't know what to do

Posts.Content: Hi littlesusie Sounds like a wonderful weekend.   Xxxx
Posts.Title: It seemed like a good idea at the time!!

Posts.Content: Ha, ha I mean complan, (predictive text).  The complan  is a meal in a drink ( chicken soup, strawberry or chocolate shake).   Can be bought at supermarkets and chemists it's fortified with vitamins and minerals and is handy when you don't have a big apietite  or along with a light meal.
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Mags22 Your mum is very lucky to have such a lovely supportive family. During chemo I was told to avoid soft yoked or raw eggs, soft cheeses like Brie ect, (but Philadelphia is ok it's pasteurised ) and yoghurt , because of live bacteria when your immune system is low, by the breast care nurse.  Otherwise eat what ever you feel like, not to stress.  Some days it was cerial and complain.   Wishing you all the best xxx
Posts.Title: Marker clip and chemo?

Posts.Content: Hay happy 1 yr survivor day tomorrow.  Have a celebration, fantastic x
Posts.Title: 1 year on...

Posts.Content: Hi alicemay Sending you big cyber hugs.     Hope for the best, it good they are investigating if they have any suspisions at all.  I have my pre radiotherapy appointment tomorrow.  Chemo , right side mastectomy and aux clearance done and on lentazole.  I am so grateful it was picked up and getting treated.  Fingers crossed.   Xxxx
Posts.Title: Mammogram

Posts.Content: Hi This reminds me of when I was diagnosed, my daughter said chemo was wrong and people had been cured by meditation!  It has it's place indeed, but no as a sole cure.  If I died, was I a failure for not meditating enough.  This reminded me of my mum, she had chronic depression and was in and out of hospital and had loads of different medication.  She went to a faith healer and prayed so hard for a cure.  It added to her depression with more guilt when there was no difference and was hospitalised again.  People stand on the sidelines and don't think of what they are saying.  So sad. Shirl x
Posts.Title: Dangerous internet information

Posts.Content: Hi mrt  Its hard to get the news you have BC .  I opted to get the result by phone as I was going 400 miles to visit my daughter, as I had planned for ages.  So I was in a busy market in Wales.  it let me break the news to my daughter in person and spend a bit of time with her before I returned home.  The planning meeting was the following week and then it all went quiet fast, chemo ,surgery and radio therapy.  I asked how long the cancer had been there ? I was told they couldn't tell but tests biopsy's told them it was in the breast and lymph nodes .  Now it has been cleared and there is no evidence of disease.  It is treatable and now you have things moving some lovely folk will get things done for you.  Phone your local breast nurse specialist and ask any questions you have or talk to us on this site we have all experience of BC .  Some like your selves are starting out on this journey or in the middle of it or come out the other end of it.   Thoughts with you both.  The waiting is hard try and find some nice distractions if you can, no point in saying don't worry but breast cancer is very treatable and you've done one of the hardest bits going to the doc and getting thingsmoving.   Hope this help a bit.  X
Posts.Title: Partner has just been diagnosed with Breast Cancer

Posts.Content: Hi Denise  I saw this lasses fb thingy I thought it was quiet brave and yes folk can sometimes seem a bit patronising patting you on the head and say how well you are taking it or you look so well or you such an inspiration, such a fighter.   When you feel like shit and it cuts off meaningful  conversation.  Some folk can't cope too well with reality so we need to be gentle.  I see her point, I know it's scary and we all know it happens but many more DO recover from BC.  So take heart girls and give this lass some sympathy.  Celebrate what we have come though and enjoy.  Xxx
Posts.Title: Is it just me ...

Posts.Content: Hi mrs D. Sorry to hear you've been poorly, low immunity is a pest. Have alovely evening.  Hope it all goes well tomorrow .  Xx
Posts.Title: No place like home !

Posts.Content: Hi Nonrag Great to hear how well you are doing.  My hair is quarter an inch long!  Eyebrows are coming back , it's a couple of months since chemo finished and 4weeks since mastectomy , a weeks from now I start radiotherapy for 3 week, end is in site. Woo hoo.   Xxx
Posts.Title: extremely dry scalp
